III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultant provided feedback on having consistency with making sure all
new hire references are dated when completed.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
2

• Consultant provided a copy of the variance for Rule 400.10115
Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
• Consultant provided information about PA 280: 400.14d Juvenile
residential care facility in county with population less than 50,000; direct
care worker; qualification; conflict with administrative rule. The county this
facility is located has a population of less than 50,000 which allows a direct
care worker to be hired if they have completed high school or obtained a
general equivalency diploma (GED).
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and staff noted they enjoy
their jobs. They feel very well supported by their direct supervisor and
administration. When asked if there were anything they would change about their
jobs, Staff reported they would like to continue to get ongoing training about drug
abuse and human trafficking as they live in a small rural county and do not
experience that much.
Three youth were interviewed during the inspection. They all reported they feel safe
at the facility and having a positive relationship with staff. The youth reported they
really enjoy the home cooked meals and having school at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on February 8, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
